official_title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of Congress that nuclear war represents the world's greatest potential health hazard, that the arms race between the United States and the Soviet Union be halted through a mutual, verifiable agreement, and that all nuclear weapons in the world should be eliminated.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that nuclear war represents a great hazard and should be prevented. Urges the President to propose: (1) that the United States and the Soviet Union begin negotiations to reduce substantially their nuclear arsenals; and (2) that conferences should be held among all nuclear nations to propose annual reductions and gradual elimination of all nuclear weapons.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of Congress that nuclear war represents the world's greatest potential health hazard, that the arms race between the United States and the Soviet Union be halted through a mutual, verifiable agreement, and that all nuclear weapons in the world should be eliminated.
